item.title: Are We Finally Out of IPv4 Addresses?
item.description:
For years, experts have predicted a looming internet crisis that has been largely dismissed. The internet, exceeding its initial scope, is pushing against its technological limits, threatening a system crash if not addressed. This crisis point now appears to be 2010. ARIN, the organization responsible for distributing internet addresses, has issued a warning to Internet Service Providers: we’re running out of IPv4 addresses. These addresses, the foundation of the internet, are 32-bit identifiers for every device connected online...
